summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 28, 2019, discussing logistics for shipping approximately 23 boxes of evidence from FBI case files related to the Epstein investigation from New York to Virginia. It involves FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York coordinating the transfer.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Identified as a prosecutor working on the investigation, copied on the email coordinating the shipment of evidence boxes from FBI case files.

events.title: Coordination for Evidence Shipment
events.description: Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York discuss with FBI personnel the plan to ship approximately 23 boxes of evidence from FBI case files to Virginia.

events.title: Finalizing Evidence Shipment Logistics
events.description: FBI personnel confirm they have found help to handle the shipment of the evidence boxes to Virginia.

keyFacts: The document references two specific FBI case files: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062, with evidence from the latter constituting the majority of the shipment.
Approximately 23 boxes of paper evidence were being prepared for shipment from New York to Virginia in late June 2019.
The coordination involves Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, indicating active federal prosecution work on the investigation at that time.
The email chain shows logistical coordination between the FBI's New York field office and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the physical transfer of case evidence.
